refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetch a result row as an associative array

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns an associative array that corresponds to the fetched row, or &false; if there are no more rows.
monetdb_fetch_assoc returns an associative array where for each distinct field name in result a value is stored.

If two or more columns of the result have the same field names, the last column will take precedence. To access other column(s) you should either rename (alias) it in your query or use monetdb_fetch_array or monetdb_fetch_row that provide index-based field access.

example.title: monetdb_fetch_assoc example
example.programlisting:
<?php
monetdb_connect();

monetdb_query("ls;");

while($row = monetdb_fetch_assoc()) {
	printf("name=%s htype=%s ttype=%s \n",$row["name"],$row["htype"],$row["ttype"]);
}
?>

refsect1.para: See also monetdb_query, monetdb_fetch_array, monetdb_fetch_object and monetdb_fetch_row.
